greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n, k) is the number of Horizontal Convex Polyominoes with n cells and k rows.
link: R. Pemantle and M. C. Wilson, Twenty Combinatorial Examples of Asymptotics Derived from Multivariate Generating Functions, SIAM Rev., 50 (2008), no. 2, 199-272. See p. 239
mathematica: T[n_, m_] := Sum[Sum[Sum[Binomial[i - 2*j, j]*2^(i - 3*j)*Binomial[k + j, i - 2*j]*Binomial[k + 3*j - i, m + j - i - 1], {j, 0, m + i - 1}]*Binomial[ n - k - 2, n - k - i - 1], {i, 0, n - k - 1}], {k, 0, n - 1}]; Table[T[n, m], {n, 0, 10}, {m, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 27 2019, after _Vladimir Kruchinin_ *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = if( k<0 || k>n, 0, polcoeff( polcoeff( x * y *(1 - x)^3 / ((1 - x)^4 - x * y * (1 - x - x^2 + x^3 + x^2 * y)) + x * O(x^n), n), k))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 02 2016
